TopicTitle: [v1.3!] Silisko Industries Doughnut Research & Spacecraft Development

Articles.Content: Delete the original mk1pod folder and replace it with the one in the pod replacer folder. Don't place the 'donotplaceinfolder' version into the folder.

I tried the gemini style module and it didn't auto-place it in the game.

EDIT: Was trying to use the part in the pack, not the replacer. /facepalm

I gave the PAM a spin today (literally). In order to stabilize the PAM and payload, I had to spin the vehicle at full rotation, other wise the PAM just flipped the payload end over end.

The second and primary issue is when I fired the PAM from a non-thrusting vehicle, the PAM fell behind even though the PAM rocket was going. It went forward due to the decouplers impulse, but then the PAM fell behind the vehicle.

Guys guys guys guys

Update pending

Guys guys guys guys

Update pending

!

New parts and changes so far:

Added a new mini engine for orbital adjustment and landings on airless bodies

Added tiny 1m hollow decoupler, for the above engine

Added scientific module for decorative purposes

Added deployable airbag (nonfunctional for now)

Updated several textures

Added a full set of lunar lander parts (legs, descent fuel tank, ascent fuel tank, decouplers)

N1 engine made much stronger(not more powerful), hopefully preventing it from spontaneously detaching.

airbag????

[move][glow=red,2,300][shadow=red,left]![/shadow][/glow][/move]
Going to make second- and third-stage engine clusters for the N1 for us, Nova?
When can we expect the next saga of Nova's awesome part packs?

Added a new mini engine for orbital adjustment and landings on airless bodies

Added tiny 1m hollow decoupler, for the above engine

Added scientific module for decorative purposes

Added deployable airbag (nonfunctional for now)

Updated several textures

Added a full set of lunar lander parts (legs, descent fuel tank, ascent fuel tank, decouplers)

N1 engine made much stronger(not more powerful), hopefully preventing it from spontaneously detaching.

Extremely good news, can't wait!

I especially want to try lunar lander parts because because I have some strange issue with lander legs from this theme http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=2251.0 (the rocket constantly leans to one side with lander legs).

Only thing not in this picture is the decoupler and ascent engine.

Every bit is an individual part.
Any chance you could start a new pack? Seems redundant downloading a ton of textures and models, most of which haven't changed in several versions.

Only thing not in this picture is the decoupler and ascent engine.

Every bit is an individual part.

How long does it take to assemble in the VAB?
Working on things tends to produce a lot of wayward stuff on the side:
So, how long before we can take her for a spin?
I wish I could read the lower tack-on sign, beyond the first line...

The lander parts are going to be their own release.

The rest of the SIDR update will be up soon.

Any chance you could make new couplers for larger parts?

I would love to see a 3 meter quad-coupler! :stirpot:
Hells yeah, 1.75 metre quad coupler too. And a lateral coupler like the 1m versions which has a titan-like configuration. (3 connected together linearly.)
Stupid bug report - the orbital liquid engine has the 'description' in the 'manufacturer' black

Hells yeah, 1.75 metre quad coupler too. And a lateral coupler like the 1m versions which has a titan-like configuration. (3 connected together linearly.)

You can already get the latter by using the 1.75m lateral stack decouplers and symmetry to place two of them.
Bug Report: The K-1 Rocket Scrap fuel cells are in three segments. There\'s a gap between upper and middle parts.
There\'s *supposed* to be. There\'s a cage decoupler that goes between them, just like in real life.

Bug Report: The K-1 Rocket Scrap fuel cells are in three segments. There\'s a gap between upper and middle parts.

Needs motors and decouplers in between the stages

@ Silisko: I\'m refining my mun candidate (which would be going quicker if you would just release your lander ), and I wanted to ask if the docking claw is working? I cannot for life of me get two seperated stages to reconnect using it.

The idea is, using the stackable chute, to put a habitation module and return tank / engine on top the lander. Then when it\'s in a stable mun orbit, detach the lander, land, ascend, redock to habitation module. Once redocked we burn home. However as I say I cannot get the docking claws to work, and attempts at docking take a bit of time to set up (fun though).

Cheers.
